text: So, next cool in-progress thing: the ability to run DRP without needing to upload ISO images or sledgehammer
I am adding the ability for DRP to transparently proxy the HTTP and TFTP requests needed to PXE boot systems to user-defined remote URLs.
This piggy-backs on top of the package-repositories support I added a month or so ago.

As long as the kernel and initrd files are present in the remote repo in the relative locations defined by the bootenv, DRP will be able to act as an intermediate proxy for all incoming TFTP and HTTP requests for these files.

attachments.title: WIP Add initial code for complete ISO-less installs by VictorLowther 路 Pull Request #596 路 digitalrebar/provision
attachments.text: Still needs better unit tests, docs, and actual live testing, but this is the first pass of adding support for letting DRP work without needing to upload isos or Sledgehammer issues. Please review
attachments.fallback: GitHub: WIP Add initial code for complete ISO-less installs by VictorLowther 路 Pull Request #596 路 digitalrebar/provision
